title: Personal use combat data logs and meters app?

comments.author: StevenL.3761
comments.body:
The game client exposes some of this data to specialized Logitech keyboards. You can tap into this data by replacing Logitech’s DLL with your own DLL.

Here’s an example of an app that does this: http://www.gw2hud.com/

More detailed discussion: https://forum-en.guildwars2.com/forum/community/api/Corsair-K70-Question/first#post4814892

comments.author: Swagger.1459
comments.body: Well, if it is indeed already possible, then the journey is already halfway there. Devs can make a better path to access realtime stats, while aspiring programmers do the “heavy lifting” and create the legit personal use app.

comments.body:
I see, thank you very much for the reply.

comments.author: Lawton Campbell.8517
comments.body: There aren’t well-defined plans for it, no. If there were it’d be under the big ball of “have the game client provide a websocket-based service for local applications” but that’s kind of a large undertaking and a bit outside the purview of the web team. We’re mostly focusing on JSON-REST endpoints for now, which have the unfortunate drawback of being totally unable to provide real-time data.

comments.author: Swagger.1459
comments.body:
Any plans to allow individual players more transparency with their numbers and data in the form of detailed combat charts along with heal, damage, threat meters? Like a personal use skada or recount type app?

I’m talking personal use, not group monitoring stuff.

I believe having more access to numbers would be great considering roles and gear are becoming more important for end game stuff like raids and fractals. It would also help players provide accurate and factual feedback to developers about skills and powers. Bug detection could be made easier for players too… Having more transparency would definitely be a benefit to both players and developers.
